jgame.controller

Class KeyboardLocationController

  • java.lang.Object
    • jgame.controller.AbstractLocRotController
      • jgame.controller.KeyboardLocationController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Controller

    public class KeyboardLocationController
extends AbstractLocRotController
    A controller that controls an objects location based on keyboard input defined by the given ControlScheme.
    Author:
    William Chargin

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private ControlScheme controlScheme
      The control scheme for this keyboard controller.
      private boolean horizontalAllowed
      Whether this controller allows horizontal movement.
      private boolean verticalAllowed
      Whether this controller allows vertical movement.

    • Constructor Detail

      • KeyboardLocationController

        public KeyboardLocationController(ControlScheme controlScheme,
                                  double speed)
        Creates the controller with the given control scheme.
        Parameters:
        controlScheme - the control scheme to use
        speed - the speed at which to move (in px/frame)

      • KeyboardLocationController

        public KeyboardLocationController(ControlScheme controlScheme,
                                  double speed,
                                  boolean rotateToFollow,
                                  int rotationOffset)
        Creates the controller with the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        controlScheme - the control scheme to use
        speed - the speed at which to move (in px/frame)
        rotateToFollow - whether the controller should rotate the object to follow the path
        rotationOffset - the rotation offset (default is 0)

    • Method Detail

      • calculateControl

        protected java.awt.geom.Point2D calculateControl(GObject target,
                                                 Context context)
        Description copied from class: AbstractLocRotController
        Calculates the required control the given object with the given context. This method will only be invoked after an immediately preceding call to AbstractLocRotController.canControl(GObject, Context) with the same parameters, and only if said method call returns true.
        Specified by:
        calculateControl in class AbstractLocRotController
        Parameters:
        target - the object to control
        context - the context
        Returns:
        a point representing the displacement as a result of the transform in the form new Point(dx, dy), where dx is the displacement in the positive x direction and dy is the displacement in the positive y direction

      • canControl

        protected boolean canControl(GObject target,
                             Context context)
        Description copied from class: AbstractLocRotController
        Determines whether the given target can be controlled in the given context.
        Specified by:
        canControl in class AbstractLocRotController
        Parameters:
        target - the target
        context - the context
        Returns:
        true if the target can be controlled, or false if it cannot

        public boolean isHorizontalAllowed()
        Determines whether this controller allows horizontal movement.
